meanings.definition: Of or relating to the pathological effects on cells.
meanings.sent1: The cytopathic changes in the cells were evident under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the virus was cytopathic, causing harm to the cells.
meanings.sent3: The cytopathic cells seemed to be throwing a party, but it was definitely not a good one.
meanings.sent4: The cytopathic impact on the cells was like a wrecking ball, destroying everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The cytopathic nature of the disease made it spread rapidly throughout the body.

meanings.definition: Causing damage or disease to cells.
meanings.sent1: The cytopathic virus quickly spread and infected many cells in the body.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the cytopathic effects of the chemical on the cells in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The cytopathic cells were like troublemakers, disrupting the normal functioning of the body.
meanings.sent4: The cytopathic damage to the cells was akin to a wildfire, spreading uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The doctor warned about the cytopathic properties of the substance, urging caution in handling it.
